vague_description: How can a man meet his nutritional requirements through a diet of vegetables and fruits while minimizing his expenses?
detailed_description: A man only eats vegetables and fruits. A serving of vegetables contains \var{VitVeg} units of vitamins and \var{MinVeg} units of minerals. A serving of fruit contains \var{VitFruit} units of vitamins and \var{MinFruit} units of minerals. He wants to eat at least \var{MinVit} units of vitamins and \var{MinMin} units of minerals. If vegetables cost \var{CostVeg} per serving and fruits cost \var{CostFruit} per serving, how many servings of each should he eat to minimize his cost?
target_objective: Minimize the cost of the servings of vegetables and fruits
target_constraints: Number of servings of vegetables is non-negative
Number of servings of fruits is non-negative
Total units of vitamins from vegetables and fruits must be at least MinVit
Total units of minerals from vegetables and fruits must be at least MinMin
target_parameters: Units of vitamins provided by a serving of vegetables
Units of minerals provided by a serving of vegetables
Units of vitamins provided by a serving of fruits
Units of minerals provided by a serving of fruits
Cost of one serving of vegetables
Cost of one serving of fruits
